str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From ana and choreo; to retire.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A ship, vessel, boat. From pleo; a sailer, i.e. Vessel.
Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Lonesome, i.e. waste.
Apparently a primary word; a spot, i.e. Location; figuratively, condition, opportunity; specially, a scabbard.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a derivative of echo; a throng; by implication, the rabble; by extension, a class of people; figuratively, a riot.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To accompany, attend, follow. Properly, to be in the same way with, i.e. To accompany.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
On foot, by land. Dative case feminine of a derivative of pous; foot-wise, i.e. By walking.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.
